basics.name: Christina Nelson
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Physics and a minor in C.S. at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2017.

interests.name: Experimental particle physics and computer science applications to physics analysis and simulations, such as Monte Carlo methods and machine learning on very large data sets.

awards.title: UROP
awards.summary: Accepted proposal to experiment: Magnetization of novel multiferroic materials

awards.title: CERN Univeristy of Michigan REU
awards.summary: Winter semester research at CERN with the Exotics group in ATLAS working in the diHiggs to 4b chanel
Contributed to software development tools for physics analysis, Monte Carlo simulation at 13 TeV and data at 7 TeV.

awards.title: SULI at Fermilab
awards.summary: Summer reu at Fermilab working with the Mu2e simulation group
Built a toy model of the detector and calorimeter for Mu2e with a C++ and ROOT implementation in the MARS model
Componenets of detector: geometry, magnetic field gradient, chemical composition, particle interaction and trajectory

work.summary: Collaboration on neutrino experiments: DUNE, NuLat, LPS
highlights: Calibration and characterization of SiPMs, and PMTs
Data analysis via software and oscilloscope reading, circuit building
mechanical construction, cryogenic handling, optical laser operation
Peer mentor to students in STEM center for Computer Science I and II
Aided students in concepts of object oriented programming, algorithm development
debugging, abstract data types, and data structures
